get.summary: Get movie critics name, bio and image.
get.description: Get movie critics. You can either specify the reviewer name or use "all", "full-time", or "part-time".

parameters.name: reviewer
parameters.description: Reviewer name or "all" for all reviewers, "full-time" for full-time reviewers, or "part-time" for part-time reviewers.

401.description: Unauthorized request.  Make sure api-key is set.

429.description: Too many requests.  You reached your per minute or per day rate limit.

get.description:
Get movie reviews.  Can filter to only return Critics' Picks.
Supports ordering results by-title, by-publication-date, or by-opening-date.
Use offset to paginate thru results, 20 at a time.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Filter by critics' pick or not.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Sets the starting point of the result set.  Needs to be multiple of 20.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: How to order the results.

status.description: Status of call, should be OK.

has_more.description: Whether there are more results to paginate thru.

num_results.description: Number of movies returned in the API response results array.

401.description: Unauthorized request.  Make sure api-key is set.

429.description: Too many requests.  You reached your per minute or per day rate limit.

get.description: Search for movie reviews.  Supports filtering by Critics' Pick.

parameters.name: critics-pick
parameters.description: Set to Y to only show critics' picks.  Otherwise shows both.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Sets the starting point of the result set (0, 20, ...).  Used to paginate thru results. Defaults to 0. The has_more field indicates the response has more results.

parameters.name: opening-date
parameters.description: U.S. opening date range. Start and end dates separated by semicolon (e.g. 1930-01-01;1940-01-01).  Don't set end date if you want open ended (e.g. 2019-01-01).

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Field to order results by (e.g. by-publication-date).

parameters.name: publication-date
parameters.description: Review publication date range. Start and end dates separated by semicolon (e.g. 1930-01-01;1940-01-01).

parameters.name: reviewer
parameters.description: Filter by reviewer byline (e.g. Stephen Holden).

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Search keyword (e.g. lebowski).

401.description: Unauthorized request.  Make sure api-key is set.

429.description: Too many requests.  You reached your per minute or per day rate limit.

get.description:
Get replies to a comment.  You need to pass in the article's URL and the comment sequence number of the parent comment.

```
https://api.nytimes.com/svc/community/v3/user-content/replies.json?api-key={your-API-key}&url={url}&commentSequence={sequence}[&offset=int]
```

```
https://api.nytimes.com/svc/community/v3/user-content/replies.json?api-key=your-key&offset=0&url=https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2019/04/30/dining/climate-change-food-eating-habits.html&commentSequence=100268335
```

The response includes the parent comment and up to 25 replies.  The replyCount field has the total number of replies.
Use offset query parameter to paginate thru results, 25 replies at a time (0,25,50, ...).

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: Article URL to get comments for.

parameters.name: commentSequence
parameters.description: Parent comment sequence number.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Sets starting point of result set (0, 25, 50, ...). Used to paginate thru replies. Defaults to 0. The replyCount field indicates how many replies there are for the parent comment.

401.description: Unauthorized request.  Make sure api-key is set.

429.description: Too many requests.  You reached your per minute or per day rate limit.

get.description:
Get top-level comments associated with a specific NYTimes.com URL.

```
https://api.nytimes.com/svc/community/v3/user-content/url.json?api-key={your-API-key}&url={url}[&offset=int]
```

```
https://api.nytimes.com/svc/community/v3/user-content/url.json?api-key=your-key&offset=0&url=https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2019/04/30/dining/climate-change-food-eating-habits.html
```

The response includes 25 top-level comments at a time.  Use offset query parameter to paginate thru results (0,25,50, ...).  The total number of top-level comments is returned in the totalParentCommentsFound field.
The response includes up to 3 replies.  If there are more than 3 replies for a top-level comment, use the replies endpoint to get the rest.  The replyCount field has the total number of replies.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: Article URL to get comments for.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Sets starting point of result set (0, 25, 50, ...). Used to paginate thru top-level article comments. Defaults to 0. The totalParentCommentsFound field indicates how many top-level comments there are.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Search comments by newest first, oldest first, or with most reader recommendations first.

401.description: Unauthorized request.  Make sure api-key is set.

429.description: Too many requests.  You reached your per minute or per day rate limit.

parameters.name: isbn
parameters.description: Searching by ISBN is the recommended method. You can enter 10- or 13-digit ISBNs.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: You’ll need to enter the full title of the book. Spaces in the title will be converted into the characters %20.

parameters.name: author
parameters.description: You’ll need to enter the author’s first and last name, separated by a space. This space will be converted into the characters %20.

parameters.name: age-group
parameters.description: The target age group for the best seller.

parameters.name: author
parameters.description:
The author of the best seller. The author field does not include additional contributors (see Data Structure for more details about the author and contributor fields).

When searching the author field, you can specify any combination of first, middle and last names.

When sort-by is set to author, the results will be sorted by author's first name.

parameters.name: contributor
parameters.description:
The author of the best seller, as well as other contributors such as the illustrator (to search or sort by author name only, use author instead).

When searching, you can specify any combination of first, middle and last names of any of the contributors.

When sort-by is set to contributor, the results will be sorted by the first name of the first contributor listed.

parameters.name: isbn
parameters.description:
International Standard Book Number, 10 or 13 digits

A best seller may have both 10-digit and 13-digit ISBNs, and may have multiple ISBNs of each type. To search on multiple ISBNs, separate the ISBNs with semicolons (example: 9780446579933;0061374229).

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Sets the starting point of the result set (0, 20, ...).  Used to paginate thru results if there are more than 20. Defaults to 0. The num_results field indicates how many results there are total.

parameters.name: price
parameters.description: The publisher's list price of the best seller, including decimal point.

parameters.name: publisher
parameters.description: The standardized name of the publisher

parameters.name: title
parameters.description:
The title of the best seller

When searching, you can specify a portion of a title or a full title.

get.description: Get top 5 books for all the Best Sellers lists for specified date.

parameters.name: published_date
parameters.description:
YYYY-MM-DD

The best-seller list publication date.
You do not have to specify the exact date the list was published. The service will search forward (into the future) for the closest publication date to the date you specify. For example, a request for lists/overview/2013-05-22 will retrieve the list that was published on 05-26.

If you do not include a published date, the current week's best sellers lists will be returned.

get.description: Get Best Sellers list by date.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
YYYY-MM-DD or "current"

The date the best sellers list was published on NYTimes.com.  Use "current" to get latest list.

parameters.name: list
parameters.description: Name of the Best Sellers List (e.g. hardcover-fiction). You can get the full list of names from the /lists/names.json service.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Sets the starting point of the result set (0, 20, ...).  Used to paginate thru books if list has more than 20. Defaults to 0.  The num_results field indicates how many books are in the list.

get.description: Get Best Sellers list.  If no date is provided returns the latest list.

parameters.name: list
parameters.description:
The name of the Times best sellers list (hardcover-fiction, paperback-nonfiction, ...).
The /lists/names service returns all the list names.
The encoded list names are lower case with hyphens instead of spaces (e.g. e-book-fiction, instead of E-Book Fiction).

parameters.name: bestsellers-date
parameters.description:
YYYY-MM-DD

The week-ending date for the sales reflected on list-name. Times best sellers lists are compiled using available book sale data. The bestsellers-date may be significantly earlier than published-date. For additional information, see the explanation at the bottom of any best-seller list page on NYTimes.com (example: Hardcover Fiction, published Dec. 5 but reflecting sales to Nov. 29).

parameters.name: published-date
parameters.description:
YYYY-MM-DD

The date the best sellers list was published on NYTimes.com (different than bestsellers-date).  Use "current" for latest list.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Sets the starting point of the result set (0, 20, ...).  Used to paginate thru books if list has more than 20. Defaults to 0.  The num_results field indicates how many books are in the list.

parameters.name: begin_date
parameters.description: Begin date (e.g. 20120101)

parameters.name: end_date

parameters.name: facet_fields

parameters.name: facet_filter

parameters.name: fl

parameters.name: fq

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number (0, 1, ...)

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Query

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sort order

get.description: The Top Stories API returns an array of articles currently on the specified section.

parameters.name: section
parameters.description: The section the story appears in.

401.description: Unauthorized request.  Make sure api-key is set.

429.description: Too many requests.  You reached your per minute or per day rate limit.

status.description: Status of the critic (full-time, part-time, or null).

seo-name.description: Critic name for URL (spaces are replaced with hyphens and periods removed).

type.description: Type of resource (always set to image).
Type of asset linked to. Always article.

critics_pick.description: Set to 1 if a critics' pick and 0 if not.

byline.description: Author of the review (e.g. Manohla Dargis).

date_updated.description: Last modified date of the review.
